body:
I have a spack tree that I've been working in for a while; I was pleasantly surprised when I noticed that *lmod* modulefiles were being automagically created.

I cloned a clean tree yesterday to try an end-to-end build of my environment and:

- `.../share/spack/lmod` is no longer present; and
-  `spack module refresh --help` does not list `lmod` as an available type of module, `spack module refresh` offers to rebuild all my *tcl* modules.

I'm not sure what, if anything, I did go end up with *lmod* modules in my old tree and/or what I've done to loose them in the new tree.

I read through the [module file support](lib/spack/docs/module_file_support.rst) docs,  but they did not shed any light.

Should something be happening automagically that isn't, or do I need to configure something, or???
title: Lmod modules no longer autogenerated, not avail as option to `module refresh`?
